intro: Centaurea tagana, commonly known as the Tagana knapweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Centaurea tagana is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open fields.
